meanings.sent1: The pots and pans brattle in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I heard the leaves brattle in the wind outside.
meanings.sent3: The old car seemed to brattle with excitement as it started up.
meanings.sent4: The hailstones brattle against the window, creating a cacophony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The loose shutters on the house brattle loudly during the storm.

meanings.sent1: The brattle of the train passing by could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The sudden brattle of dishes falling to the floor startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected brattle of laughter from the audience caught the comedian off guard.
meanings.sent4: The brattle of keys jingling in his pocket was a familiar sound to her.
meanings.sent5: The brattle of hooves on the cobblestone street signaled the arrival of the royal carriage.
